translation.GTS: Gabriel Terra Simões - Computer Engineering Student, UNAERP
translation.GRP: Gabriel Reverso Pereira - Computer Engineering Student, UNAERP
translation.dev_note2: Codap was created by two computer engineering students from the University of Ribeirão Preto - UNAERP - being the winner of the 14th computer challenge at the university. Our intention with Codap is to expand the horizon of knowledge and, at the same time, bring part of what can be done with WEB development to people who are curious or want to start out as a WEB developer. We hope you have a good journey of getting to know each other with Cody, our faithful helper.
translation.pictures: Some images used in the application are not our own and were obtained from the freepick website
translation.Oops: There are no classes for this module yet. We will bring new, better and more interactive classes soon!

translation.buy double time: Do you really want to buy Double Time for your next class?

translation.you have double time: You won Double Time for the Next Class!

conhecendo html.Estrutura_mainText: Hello, this is NAME. Shall we learn HTML? HTML is a markup language widely used in building web pages.
conhecendo html.Estrutura_secondText: First, I will show a very basic structure so you can get an idea of what HTML looks like.
conhecendo html.Estrutura_endText: As you can see, it's quite simple, but there are many other elements that can be added to this structure to create amazing websites.
conhecendo html.TagsElements_txt: Now that we've seen the structure, let's better understand what's in it.
conhecendo html.TagsElements_adicionaltxt: The structure is formed by opening and closing tags, which are indicated by these arrows <>. Inside them is the name of the element.
conhecendo html.TagsElements_adicionaltxt_end: Remember, the structure MUST be between the <html> </html> tags. If not, your site will not work!
conhecendo html.HtmlStartEx1_adicionaltxt: Most tags have an opening and a closing. The content is between them.
conhecendo html.HtmlStartEx1_pergunta: <html> represents an opening tag, what would a closing tag look like?
conhecendo html.HtmlStartEx2_adicionaltxt: What is the name of the element in the following code?
conhecendo html.HtmlStartEx4_pergunta: Which of the options is correct?
conhecendo html.HtmlStartEx5_pergunta: What happens if you don't put the <html> tag at the beginning and end of the project?
conhecendo html.HtmlStartEx5_opt2: The site works, but with some limitations

title.H1h6_txt: The main texts can be written using the <h1> tag, where the number next to 'h' indicates the text size
title.H1h6_adicionaltxt_end: The smaller the number, the larger the text font. Indicating its level of importance.
title.HeaderEx1_adicionaltxt: Normally the <h1> is used for creating titles on your page
title.HeaderEx1_pergunta: code a title written Codap is awesome
title.HeaderEx2_pergunta: how is the title of a page made
title.HeaderEx3_adicionaltxt: The <h2> can be used to write subtitles
title.HeaderEx3_pergunta: Write a subtitle that appears CODAP
title.HeaderEx4_pergunta: Which of the options is not correct?
title.HeaderEx5_pergunta: Which of the options represents a subtitle?

phrase.P_txt:

.
phrase.P_adicionaltxt: Functionally using one or the other would change nothing, but it would hinder the reading of the code and search engines.
phrase.FraseEx1_pergunta: Which of the options below represents a sentence written CODAP?
phrase.FraseEx2_pergunta:
What are the reasons for using

instead of ?
phrase.FraseEx2_opt2: is lighter and easier to use
phrase.FraseEx2_opt3: facilitates the reading of the code and search engines
phrase.FraseEx2_opt4: puts visual effects in the sentence
phrase.FraseEx3_pergunta: Write a sentence that appears Coding is cool
phrase.FraseEx4_pergunta: Code a sentence written HELLO WORLD

buttons.ButtonHtml_txt: Buttons are interactive elements used for various functions.
buttons.ButtonHtml_adicionaltxt: To create your button, just write <button>text</button>
buttons.ButtonEx2_adicionaltxt: What will appear with the code below?
buttons.ButtonEx2_opt2: Nothing, because the tag is wrong

images.ImgTeoric_mainText: There are elements that can close in the same tag, but they need attributes along with the name to work correctly.
images.ImgTeoric_secondText: The <img/> element needs a 'src' attribute containing a link to display the image.
images.ImgTeoric_endText: You can use both double quotes and single quotes to put the image link. You can add an image from a file, but we will only focus on how to add via link.
images.Img1_pergunta: Create an image element with the following options:
images.Img2_adicionaltxt: You can add attributes to increase or decrease the height and width of the image proportionally.
images.Img2_pergunta: Create an image element that adjusts the height using the 'height' attribute:
images.Img3_pergunta: Now create an image element that adjusts the width using the 'width' attribute:
images.Img4_adicionaltxt: You can adjust both sides manually, but lose the proportion of the image.
images.Img4_pergunta: Adjust to 50 pixels high and 30 pixels wide.
images.Img5_adicionaltxt: What will appear with the following code?
images.Img6_pergunta: Which of these options shows the correct use of the <img/> element?

comments.Comentario_mainText: Let's put a comment in your HTML document?
comments.Comentario_secondText: Comments are used to facilitate the visualization of what the elements are doing in your project, making it easier to maintain and understand it.
comments.Comentario_endText: Notice that they are not visible on your site.
comments.ComentarioEx2_adicionaltxt: You can even put elements in the comment, but of course they will not be shown.
comments.ComentarioEx3_pergunta: Write HELLO WORLD in the comment:
comments.ComentarioEx4_pergunta: How do you create a comment?
comments.ComentarioEx5_pergunta: What can be inside the comment?
comments.ComentarioEx6_pergunta: Using what you learned, write a CODAP written comment:

translation.lets learn CSS: Hello, this is NAME, let's learn CSS? CSS is a mechanism for adding styles to a web document.
translation.CSS code can be applied directly to html: CSS code can be applied directly to html tags or contained within <style> tags
translation.CSS example: The 'p' inside the <style> in the example is a selector, this represents that all elements with the same name as the selector will receive that style.
translation.what is the role of CSS?: What is the role of CSS?
translation.what does the h1 selector indicate?: What does the h1 selector indicate?
translation.indicates that every h1 element will be: Indicates that every h1 element will be deleted
Indicates that every h1 element will be replaced by h2
translation.indicates that every h1 element will obt: Indicates that every h1 element will obtain styles
translation.indicates that every h1 element will be: Indicates that every h1 element will be executede as js
translation.create blue color style for h1: Create a blue color style for h1
translation.congratulations: Congratulations, you were made for this!

common.tutorial end: If you need help, just click the question mark button at the top of the screen. Now close this tutorial and enjoy the class!
common.tutorial timer: Sometimes you will have a timer at the top of the screen on advanced topics. Be fast, I know you can do it!

theory.tutorial theory 1: I'm here to help you, this is your theoretical class. In it you will have a brief explanation of what you will learn in this topic and an example code.
theory.tutorial theory 2: Note that here you will have a window with an example code. If you can't see all the code, drag it to the side as shown above.
theory.tutorial theory 3: In most topics you will see the 'index' and 'web' buttons above the code, press them to switch between the sample code and the website it generates.
theory.tutorial theory 4: In the 'web' window, you can drag to all sides (vertical and horizontal), in addition to being able to double tap for a slight zoom in the window.

option_exercise.option 1: In this exercise you will test what you have learned from theory, whether a concept or a review of a certain code.
option_exercise.option 2: You should choose one of the options to answer the question and click the button to check if you got it right.
option_exercise.option 3: If you got it right, you will be redirected to the next exercise. But if you got it wrong, don't worry, read the question again or go back to the theory and try again, don't give up!

select_exercise.select 1: In this exercise you should click on the blocks to build a code from the options provided.
select_exercise.select 2: Click on the blocks to build the code and check if you got it right. Remember, not all options need to be used!
select_exercise.select 3: If you have placed an incorrect option, use the arrow on the side to delete the content and redo it.

text_exercise.text 1: This exercise is simple, in it you should write what is proposed by the exercise. Without error, you can do it!
text_exercise.text 2: A useful tip is to try to write exactly as it was asked. Spaces or uppercase/lowercase letters in the wrong places can confuse our friend when evaluating your performance. So be careful with accidental spaces.
